meanings.definition: The quality of being calm and even-tempered.
meanings.sent1: Her equableness in handling difficult situations impressed everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: His equableness during the storm helped keep everyone else calm.
meanings.sent3: The equableness of the cat as it watched the chaos unfold was oddly comforting.
meanings.sent4: The equableness of the old oak tree in the face of the raging storm was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The equableness of the lake's surface mirrored the tranquility of her mind.

meanings.definition: The state of being fair and impartial.
meanings.sent1: The equableness of the judge ensured a just outcome for all parties involved.
meanings.sent2: His equableness in making decisions earned him the respect of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The equableness of the referee's calls left both teams satisfied with the game.
meanings.sent4: The equableness of the scales of justice symbolized the fairness of the legal system.
meanings.sent5: The equableness of her actions showed her commitment to being unbiased.
